<div class="content-wrap-spp fw" id="primary" role="main">
<article class="post-65268 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-coronavirus category-featured category-latest category-covid-stats tag-coronavirus tag-iss tag-italy tag-prof-walter-ricciardi tag-statistics tag-swiss-propaganda-research tag-the-telegraph" id="post-65268">
<div class="before-post">
<div class="before-meta">
<div class="post-date">
Mar 23, 2020
</div>
<div class="post-comments">
<a href="https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/#comments"><i class="far fa-comments"></i> 596</a> </div>
</div>
<h1 class="post-title">
<span class="the-title">Italy: Only 12% of “Covid19 deaths” list Covid19 as cause</span> <span class="subtitle">Report shows up to 88% of Italy’s alleged Covid19 deaths could be misattributed</span> </h1>
<div class="post-author">
<a href="https://off-guardian.org/author/admin/" title="All posts by Editor">Editor</a> </div>
</div>
<div class="post_page-content post">
<a href="https://off-guardian.org/wp-content/medialibrary/merlin_170184855_3af32282-4b95-41e0-ba1b-62d1663e2dff-superJumbo.jpg?x46269"><img alt="" class="aligncenter size-offg-header-image wp-image-65271" decoding="async" height="900" src="https://off-guardian.org/wp-content/medialibrary/merlin_170184855_3af32282-4b95-41e0-ba1b-62d1663e2dff-superJumbo-2048x900.jpg?x46269" width="2048"/></a>
<p class="dropcap">The way Italy registers deaths explains their increased coronavirus case/fatality ratio, according to one expert and a report from Italy’s National Institute of Health (ISS).</p>
<p>Citing this report (in English <a href="https://www.epicentro.iss.it/coronavirus/bollettino/Report-COVID-2019_20_marzo_eng.pdf" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">here</a>), Professor Walter Ricciardi, scientific adviser to Italy’s minister of health said:</p>
<blockquote><p>The way in which we code deaths in our country is very generous in the sense that all the people who die in hospitals with the coronavirus are deemed to be dying of the coronavirus […] On re-evaluation by the National Institute of Health, only 12 per cent of death certificates have shown a direct causality from coronavirus, while 88 per cent of patients who have died have at least one pre-morbidity – many had two or three,”</p></blockquote>
<p>This has been reported widely, it was even <a href="https://www.telegraph.co.uk/global-health/science-and-disease/have-many-coronavirus-patients-died-italy/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">in <em>The Telegraph</em>,</a> and yet no one seems to be engaging with it.</p>
<p>The president of the Italian Civil Protection Service actually went out of his way to remind people of the nature of Italy’s fatality figures in a morning <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0M4kbPDHGR0&amp;feature=youtu.be&amp;t=210" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">briefing on 20/03</a>:</p>
<blockquote class="pullquote"><p>I want you to remember these people died WITH the coronavirus and not FROM the coronavirus”</p></blockquote>
<p>What does this actually mean?</p>
<p>It means that the Italian death toll figures could have been artificially inflated by <em>up to 88%</em>. If true, this would mean the total number of Italians who have <em>actually died of Covid19</em> could be as low as ~700. Which would bring Italy, currently a statistical outlier in terms of Covid19 fatalities, well in line with the rest of the world.</p>
<p>It means thousands of deaths currently widely attributed to Covid19, and being used to justify the introduction of measures equating to medical martial law, <em> may not have died of covid19 at all</em> but of their serious chronic co-morbidity (cancer, heart disease etc.).</p>
<p>This statistic is not a secret, or in any way controversial, it was in <em>The Telegraph</em> after all, but people seem to be ignoring it, or reading around it, or perhaps simply not understanding it.</p>
<p>We reported on <a href="https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/19/iss-report-99-of-covid19-deaths-already-ill/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">these statistics a few days ago</a>, and many people who should know better simply reacted to the headline without either reading the actual article or understanding the statistics.</p>
<p>Given the bill that is having its second reading in the UK parliament today, it is important this information is spread widely and quickly.</p>
<h6>This information was compiled with the assistance of the<a href="https://swprs.org/a-swiss-doctor-on-covid-19/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank"> Swiss Propaganda Research</a> group, we once again recommend everybody read their site. They are a must-read, a must-follow and a must-share. It is the best resource for Covid19 information on the internet.</h6>
<div class="support-us2" id="support-us">

<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/#comment-161049"></i></span>
</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>If die with Coronavirus or died from Coronavirus the actual cause (whatever co-morbidities may be) that leads to the death Of the person is Coronavirus. May be these co-morbidities expedited the process.</p>
</div>

<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Clearly false.  In Colorado (U... &amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2020%2F03%2F23%2Fitaly-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause%2F%23comment-177288" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>

<div class="wpd-space"></div>
<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/#comment-177288"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-reply-to">
<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-161049">
Abid Mushtaq
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Clearly false. In Colorado (USA) a 35 year old man was found dead in a park. He had a blood alcohol level of nearly .6%. This is a fatal level. Because he tested positive for COVID19, his death was listed by the Center for Disease Control as a COVID death, yet local authorities told the public, this was not correct, he died because he drank a fatal amount of alcohol. </p>
<p>You can not say an 85 year old person, who has diabetes and pneumonia, and died from symptoms of pneumonia, died from COVID because the presence of the virus was in his blood. We know that 98% of COVID cases are mild in form, not deadly.</p>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-footer">

</div>
<div class="wpd-vote-result wpd-vote-result-like wpd-up" title="9">9</div><div class="wpd-vote-result-sep"></div><div class="wpd-vote-result wpd-vote-result-dislike" title="0">0</div>

</div>

<div class="wpd-tooltip-content">
<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=In Italy, things are far worse... &amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2020%2F03%2F23%2Fitaly-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause%2F%23comment-136237" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>

<div class="wpd-space"></div>
<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/#comment-136237"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>In Italy, things are far worse!</p>
<p>Here is the smoking gun!</p>
<p>Updates.</p>
<p>As of March 26, 2020 and out of a sample of 6801 COVID-19 patients dying, the most remarkable thing is that mean age of patients dying for COVID-2019 infection was 78 and that as far as the absolute number of deaths by age group, median age for women was 82 and median age for men was 78.</p>
<p>To point out also that in Italy life expectancy is 85 for women and 81 for men.</p>
<p>The second most remarkable thing is that out of a sample of 710 COVID-19 patients dying in-hospital for whom it was possible to analyse clinic charts , 2.1% of the sample presented with a no comorbidities ( 15 deaths ) , 21.3% with a single comorbidity (151 deaths ) , 25.9% with 2 ( 184 deaths ) , and 50.7% with 3 or more ( 360 deaths ).</p>
<p>Hence, there are only 15 patients with no previous disease who died of Coronavirus and represent only 2,1% of the sample above mentioned.</p>
<p>Reference: </p>
<p><a href="https://www.epicentro.iss.it/coronavirus/bollettino/Report-COVID-2019_26_marzo_eng.pdf" rel="nofollow ugc">https://www.epicentro.iss.it/coronavirus/bollettino/Report-COVID-2019_26_marzo_eng.pdf</a></p>
<p>Anyway, the two samples from a statistical point of view are quite significant and if we extend these results to the totality of the data collected at national level which as of today ( reference: March 30, 2020 ) report a total deaths equal to 10779 and then it will turn out that 2,1% of 10779 is 226, which means that with a good statistical approximation so far throughout Italy only 226 Italians with no previous disease have died of Coronavirus.</p>
<p>In practice, out of about 60 million people residing in Italy, if we remove the approximately 24 million Italians with chronic pathologies (Report “OsservaSalute” end 2017), the result is about 36 million Italians with mild or zero pathologies, well, in reference to these about 36 million Italians with mild or no diseases, only about 226 Italians have died from Coronavirus so far which means that the death rate for Coronavirus of Italian people with mild or no diseases is equal approximately to 0,000627%!!!</p>
<p>Furthermore, the Italian media mainstream have never reported the special report above mentioned and because of the fact that some Italian people are starting to smell the rat they still just say ( only sometimes ) that the Coronavirus is the real cause of death only for a minority of Italian people.</p>
<p>Welocome to the wildest Orwellian regime ever seen in Italy since the birth of the Italian Republic, 2 June 1946.</p>
<p>Best regards.</p>
<p>Fabrice, greetings from Italy.</p>
</div>

Reply to 
<a href="#comment-136237">
Fabrice
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Integration.</p>
<p>1. To avoid any possible misunderstanding.</p>
<p> When I wrote in my two first posts ” died of” or died from”, actually I meant and I mean “died with” ( except those patients with no comorbidities who obviously died from coronavirus ) which is quite different, I hadn’t written in this right way because I’m not an English native speaker, I was also in a hurry when I was writing those two posts and so I didn’t write properly because I had taken for granted this fundamental premise that in Italy is quite known among Italian people ( a very small minority ) who are interested in counterinformation about several matters of national interest.</p>
<p>2. However, here is the update.</p>
<p>“Characteristics of COVID-19 patients dying in ItalyReport based on available data on March 30th, 2020” by Italian National Institute of Health.</p>
<p><a href="https://www.epicentro.iss.it/coronavirus/bollettino/Report-COVID-2019_30_marzo_eng.pdf" rel="nofollow ugc">https://www.epicentro.iss.it/coronavirus/bollettino/Report-COVID-2019_30_marzo_eng.pdf</a></p>
<p>The results are almost the same, it is worth emphasizing the following facts.</p>
<p>Deaths under the age of 50 years. </p>
<p>As of March 30th, 112 out of the 10,026 (1.1%) positive COVID-19 patients under the age of 50 died. In particular, 23 of these were less than 40 years, 19 men and 4 women (age range between 26 and 39years). For 2 patients under the age of 40 years no clinical information is available; the remaining 15 had serious pre-existing pathologies (cardiovascular, renal, psychiatric pathologies, diabetes, obesity) and 6 had no major pathologies.</p>
<p>It is also noteworthy that the Italian media mainstream have never spoken about this fundamental aspect of the matter and because of the fact that some Italian people are starting to smell the rat they still keep on saying ( only sometimes ) that the Coronavirus is the real cause of death only for a minority of Italian people.</p>
<p>Best regards.</p>
<p>TheTruthSeeker, greetings from Italy.</p>
</div>

You can check each country like Spain or Italy and see if the deaths toll rises due to coronvirus.</p>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Put it this way – if we didn’t KNOW that Covid-19 was a <em>different </em>flu, and we were just saying and believing that this many people were dying of “seasonal flu”, would these numbers be alarming in scope or in the population they are affecting?</p>

<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/#comment-135657"></i></span>

<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-135379">
Robbobbobin
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>not an argument.<br/>
Also, it’s not a dumbfuck way to put it. If already 60% of the UK population have had, and beat, COVID-19, without much more than a sniffle, it really is the case of would we have even known about it?<br/>
Now, we don’t have a control to compare against, so we don’t know if the infection rate would otherwise have been way higher and then way more deaths as a result.<br/>
Also, the China stuff….. how much of that would need to be faked to cause the financial collapse of the West. Has it also caused the financial collapse of China? Is that a plausible line of reasoning? Maybe not, but we should be asking the questions and exploring the answers.</p>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-footer">

</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-left">
<div class="wpd-avatar">
<img alt="Cassandra" class="avatar avatar-64 photo" decoding="async" height="64" loading="lazy" src="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/fa9acb21adb9dde27cba11059280763d?s=64&amp;d=monsterid&amp;r=pg" srcset="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/fa9acb21adb9dde27cba11059280763d?s=128&amp;d=monsterid&amp;r=pg 2x" width="64"/>

<div class="wpd-comment-right" id="comment-137720">
<div class="wpd-comment-header">
<div class="wpd-comment-author">
Cassandra
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-date" title="Mar 28, 2020 5:22 PM">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="far fa-clock"></i>
Mar 28, 2020 5:22 PM
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-share wpd-hidden wpd-tooltip wpd-top">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-share-alt"></i>
<div class="wpd-tooltip-content">
<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Another distorted story by Off... &amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2020%2F03%2F23%2Fitaly-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause%2F%23comment-137720" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-space"></div>
<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/#comment-137720"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Another distorted story by Off Guardian — one that can be easily checked if one were concerned with truth instead of propaganda. What Ricciardi actually said is: “On re-evaluation by the National Institute of Health, only 12 per cent of death certificates have shown a direct causality from coronavirus.” Key word: death certificates. [<em>This person accuses us of ‘distortion’ and then proceeds to ‘correct’ us by citing <strong> the exact quote we feature in the article! </strong> She needs to read more closely – ed</em>]</p>
<p>The head of Italy’s NHI told a different story: “But experts also warn that the death count, like the number of total infections, could actually be much higher than what is being reported since many people who die at home or in nursing care facilities are not tested if they were asymptomatic. “It is plausible that deaths are underestimated,” Silvio Brusaferro, head of Italy’s National Health Institute, said Tuesday at the daily civil protection press conference. “We report deaths that are signaled with a positive swab. Many other deaths are not tested with a swab.” </p>
<p><em> These ‘corrections’ in no way counter anything in the article, which is citations solely and wholly from the relevant Italian authorities – with no interpretation from us. This is a blatant attempt at distortion – ed</em></p>
<p><a href="https://www.thedailybeast.com/making-sense-of-italys-staggering-covid-19-death-toll" rel="nofollow ugc">https://www.thedailybeast.com/making-sense-of-italys-staggering-covid-19-death-toll</a></p>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-footer">

</div>
<div class="wpd-vote-result wpd-vote-result-like wpd-up" title="2">2</div><div class="wpd-vote-result-sep"></div><div class="wpd-vote-result wpd-vote-result-dislike wpd-down" title="-11">-11</div>
<div class="wpd-vote-down wpd_not_clicked">

<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-137720">
Cassandra
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Wow, Cassandra, now there’s a statement that is dying for a challenge.</p>
<p>It absolutely FLIES in the face of conventional scientific wisdom that ANYONE would die from a virus without showing any signs of infection.</p>
<p>If a person is asymptomatic, by definition, they are not suffering from any symptoms.</p>
<p>This virus… NO virus, causes death without some disruption of necessary bodily function. It’s the failure of your body to cope that leads to morbidity, and if the head of Italy’s NHI made such a statement, then maybe he needs to get a job at the IHN instead… the Institute of Horrendous Nonsense.</p>
<p>To put a final nail in this astounding post, below, you will find a link to a study from Wuhan. They tested close to 9.9 million people.</p>
<p>Among that 9.9 million people, they found 300 who were asymptomatic.</p>
<p>For the 300 people, they tested all of their close friends and associates… over 1700 people, and not one of them were infected with covid.</p>
<p>This virus does not run around incognito, killing by stealth.</p>
<p>If a person is asymptomatic, they aren’t even going to transmit the virus, let alone die from it.</p>
<p><a href="https://www.lifesitenews.com/news/asymptomatic-transmission-of-covid-19-didnt-occur-at-all-study-of-10-million-finds" rel="noopener nofollow ugc" target="_blank">https://www.lifesitenews.com/news/asymptomatic-transmission-of-covid-19-didnt-occur-at-all-study-of-10-million-finds</a></p>
</div>

Fabrice

<div class="wpd-comment-date" title="Mar 28, 2020 7:04 AM">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="far fa-clock"></i>
Mar 28, 2020 7:04 AM
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-share wpd-hidden wpd-tooltip wpd-top">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-share-alt"></i>
<div class="wpd-tooltip-content">
<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=In Italy, things are far worse... &amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2020%2F03%2F23%2Fitaly-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause%2F%23comment-134606" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-space"></div>
<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/#comment-134606"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>In Italy, things are far worse!</p>
<p>Here is the smoking gun!</p>
<p> As of March 20, 2020 and out of a sample of 3,200 patients treated for Coronavirus, there are only 6 patients with no previous disease who died of Coronavirus and represent only 1.2% of the sample above mentioned.</p>
<p>Reference:</p>
<p><a href="https://www.epicentro.iss.it/coronavirus/bollettino/Report-COVID-2019_20_marzo_eng.pdf" rel="nofollow ugc">https://www.epicentro.iss.it/coronavirus/bollettino/Report-COVID-2019_20_marzo_eng.pdf</a></p>
<p>Anyway, the sample from a statistical point of view is quite significant and if we extend these results to the totality of the data collected at national level which as of today ( reference: March 25, 2020 ) report a total deaths equal to 7503 and then it will turn out that 1.2% of 7503 is 90, which means that with a good statistical approximation so far throughout Italy only 90 Italians with no previous disease have died of Coronavirus.</p>
<p>In practice, out of about 60 million people residing in Italy, if we remove the approximately 24 million Italians with chronic pathologies (Report “OsservaSalute” end 2017), the result is about 36 million Italians with mild or zero pathologies, well, in reference to these about 36 million Italians with mild or no diseases, only about 90 Italians have died from Coronavirus so far which means that the rate death for Coronavirus of Italian people with mild or no diseases is equal approximately to 0,00025%!!!</p>
<p>Furthermore, the Italian media mainstream have never reported the special report above mentioned and because of the fact that some Italian people are starting to smell the rat they just say ( only sometimes ) that the Coronavirus is the real cause of death only for a minority of Italian people.</p>
<p>Welocome to the wildest Orwellian regime ever seen in Italy since the birth of the Republican Italy, 2 June 1946.</p>
<p>Best regards.</p>
<p>Fabrice, greetings from Italy.</p>
</div>

<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=I think this article is exactl... &amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2020%2F03%2F23%2Fitaly-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause%2F%23comment-134521" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>

<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/#comment-134521"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>I think this article is exactly backwards. Other countries are almost certainly undercounting their death tolls from the coronavirus. From a but-for causation standpoint, the virus is without a doubt a cause of death in these cases. In fact, especially because testing is so wanton, there’s almost certainly more deaths that have *not* been attributed to the virus at all than those that have even when underlying health issues were present. If anything, Italy is counting more accurately than other countries, not less accurately.</p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-tooltip-content">
<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=I do mean that, obviously. Pho... &amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2020%2F03%2F23%2Fitaly-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause%2F%23comment-134540" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-space"></div>
<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/#comment-134540"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-reply-to">
<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-134532">
Sam - Admin2
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>I do mean that, obviously. Phone swiping. There is indeed evidence of what I’m saying although not systematic of course. (If it were it needn’t be argued.) There are reports from doctors of undercounting in the US media, for example. But it’s also just obvious through reason. First, governments have a huge incentive to undercount and refuse testing. Second, many governments, because they are neoliberal and incompetent, have been negligent in securing adequate testing supplies and have enacted strict testing regimes that refuse testing to all but the most obvious cases. Third, it’s just the nature of how this works to undercount. Only “confirmed cases” get counted in the death toll, which means people who have died with a positive test result. This is bound to miss many deaths. Italy appears to be doing a more thorough job than any other country. And that makes sense, in fact, since the area of Italy that was hit hardest is considered to have one of the most robust health care systems in the world.</p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-reply-to">
<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-134540">
pigswiggle
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Under-testing will also miss a lot of mild and asymptomatic cases, of which there are purported to be many, as well as those who have had the virus and are now immune. Systematic testing of a sample population hasn’t been conducted, to my knowledge, and it is not known, therefore, whether the virus is indeed novel – in fact there is evidence it may not be. Until we have this data we can’t calculate accurate mortality rates. Accuracy of PCR tests has also been brought into question, and it is suggested by some that they can’t isolate CV19, rather corona viruses in general, and also can’t detect viral load, which makes differentiating an active infection from a non-active infection impossible. There are a lot of interesting posts and links on articles, I’ll let you peruse at your leisure. A2</p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/#comment-134632"></i></span>

<div class="wpd-reply-to">
<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-134555">
Sam - Admin2
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Almost all mild and asymptomatic cases will be missed. That’s the nature of every disease, and this is the case even in influenza death rate statistics. It’s considered a “case” fatality rate for this reason; a case exists where a person seeks treatment from medical professionals who then diagnose the condition. You can never–and will never–have “accurate mortality rates” in the sense that you are demanding. Every argument you make applies just as well to influenza. Note: this outbreak is objectively worse than influenza, with an objectively higher *case* fatality rate and hospital admission rate. That may well be partly or even mostly attributable to a lack of a vaccine, but that is the situation in which we presently find ourselves.</p>
</div>

Reply to 
<a href="#comment-134555">
Sam - Admin2
</a>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>And keep in mind, it’s not the deadliness per se of the coronavirus that is concerning. It’s slightly more fatal than the flu. But it’s also a very rapidly spreading virus for which nobody is vaccinated against. This is what makes it especially dangerous for vulnerable people. Which includes health care workers, who absorb massive doses of it while treating people without adequate protective gear because our capitalist governments have failed us.</p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/#comment-134742"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-reply-to">
<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-134634">
pigswiggle
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>All of this is unsubstantiated or doesn’t fit the available facts. Flu-Related mortality rates are based on projected estimates in a population-based study over a significant period of time. Covid19-related deaths are not. More often than not they are based on a very small and biased sample of ‘those tested so far’, or ‘confirmed cases’. You can spout fear propaganda if you want, but most of it isn’t accurate or the figures don’t substantiate it. </p>
<p>CV19 has actually been downgraded from a High Consequence Infectious Disease in the UK.</p>
<p>You really aren’t displaying any indication you have read the piece above. Nor are you posting any sources to back up your boldly-made assertions. These sorts of soft-trolling techniques are being used a lot atm. So please, post something with some sources or let’s end this chat for now. Thanks.</p>
</div>

Reply to 
<a href="#comment-134742">
Sam - Admin2
</a>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>RT-PCR tests can’t detect viral load, but realtime RT-PCR (rRT-PCR; qRT-PCR) can. The NHS are using realtime tests from what I can gather<br/>
Whether they can identify novel corona virus or not I haven’t discovered<br/>
<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Real-time_polymerase_chain_reaction" rel="nofollow ugc">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Real-time_polymerase_chain_reaction</a><br/>
” It monitors the amplification of a targeted DNA molecule during the PCR (i.e., in real time), not at its end, as in conventional PCR.”<br/>
<a href="https://www.england.nhs.uk/coronavirus/wp-content/uploads/sites/52/2020/03/guidance-and-sop-covid-19-virus-testing-in-nhs-laboratories-v1.pdf" rel="nofollow ugc">https://www.england.nhs.uk/coronavirus/wp-content/uploads/sites/52/2020/03/guidance-and-sop-covid-19-virus-testing-in-nhs-laboratories-v1.pdf</a><br/>
page 3 “The preferred screening/testing is molecular diagnosis of COVID-19 using<br/>
real-time RT-PCR (RdRp gene) assay based on oral swabs, which PHE<br/>
laboratories have been using to confirm this disease. “</p>
</div>

<p>Thanks for these links.</p>
<p>Doesn’t RT-PCR stand for ‘Real Time PCR’? I am little confused about that.</p>
<p><em>[comment edited – A2]</em> Interesting reading, I’m currently trying to gather info. How reliable this is in relation to virus detection I can’t see. I also think it’s worth noting that realtime and conventional PCR tests rely exclusively on the quality of the source DNA template they use, which is another area lacking clarity.</p>
<p>Interesting links, thanks. Please let me know if you have more info.</p>

<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=A virus is just an RNA fragmen... &amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2020%2F03%2F23%2Fitaly-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause%2F%23comment-137718" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>
</div>

<div class="wpd-space"></div>
<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/#comment-137718"></i></span>
</div>

<div class="wpd-reply-to">
<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-135678">
Sam - Admin2
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>A virus is just an RNA fragment with sufficient sequence similarity as to allow it to insert itself into your Gene sequence and be replicated into new DNA. Viral load may be determined by quantification of replicates expressing that sequence but it’s a touchy business. There have to be controls and an established baseline and reference gene’s from outside the target region. Typically complex algorithms accompany most commercial assays that tease out and/or control all of these variables. But they take years of clinical validation. I doubt any existing qPCR tests for COViD 19 can offer much beyond the most rudimantary information. But they can give a basic pass fail, though even that will be of questionable accuracy in any individual case.</p>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-footer">

</div>

</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Pretty clear you know nothing about PCR. qPCR is quantitative PCR. It can quantify Gene expression by comparing replication of target sequences against a control. RT-qPCR is real time qPCR and allows us to quantify in real time DNA transcription through each replication cycle using fluorescenct tagging of probes. Beyond that I have no idea what you’re trying to say and you don’t either.</p>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-footer">
<div class="wpd-vote">
<div class="wpd-vote-up wpd_not_clicked">

</div>
<div class="wpd-vote-result wpd-vote-result-like" title="0">0</div><div class="wpd-vote-result-sep"></div><div class="wpd-vote-result wpd-vote-result-dislike wpd-down" title="-4">-4</div>

</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Multiple mainstream news articles including CNN place the number of influenza deaths in the United States in 2017 at around 80,000. The articles were obviously fact checked and cite the CDC and W.H.O. as sources. The CDC website now lists the 2017 stats at 61,000 deaths for 2017. Things are getting interesting. It’s either much worse than what we see in the media or not as bad as it seems.</p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/#comment-134562"></i></span>

<div class="wpd-reply-to">
<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-134482">
Eric Blair
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>To put this in perspective, NYC has about 2.6% of the US population. If you extrapolate 600 deaths in three weeks (and really it’s closer to one or two weeks) in NYC to the entire population for a year, that’s 400,000 deaths. Now, that’s likely an overestimate because NYC is also denser than the rest of the US, but however you slice it, it’s really ugly. I’m not trying to get my parents needlessly killed.</p>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-footer">

<div class="wpd-comment-header">
<div class="wpd-comment-author">

<div class="wpd-comment-date" title="Mar 27, 2020 3:26 PM">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="far fa-clock"></i>
Mar 27, 2020 3:26 PM

<div class="wpd-comment-share wpd-hidden wpd-tooltip wpd-top">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-share-alt"></i>
<div class="wpd-tooltip-content">
<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=And yet, hospitals and morgues... &amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2020%2F03%2F23%2Fitaly-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause%2F%23comment-134160" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-space"></div>
<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/#comment-134160"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>And yet, hospitals and morgues are filling up. Yes, I get that perhaps many or most of these folks weren’t long for this world before cornavirus, but it’s inarguable that their deaths have at the very least been accelerated, perhaps by a significant factor. </p>
<p>So what’s the implication of this article? That we should just stop all the quarantines and social distancing and let the weak die? </p>
<p>Economics may well at some point force that. We shall see. </p>
<p>Meanwhile expect more government flailing around an issue that they dare not even discuss. </p>
<p>Kim G<br/>
Boston, MA<br/>
<em>Which remains on a sort of “soft lockdown.”</em></p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Kim…. it absolutely does NOT mean their deaths were accelerated. Do you know HOW many people die DAILY?</p>
<p>1.8 people die (on average)… EVERY SINGLE SECOND.</p>
<p>Now say even 10%, 20%, god… 50% of those people who are going to pass have the coronavirus… </p>
<p>That’s how you get the types of figures we’re seeing.</p>

Kim G

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<blockquote><p>So what’s the implication of this article? That we should just stop all the quarantines and social distancing and let the weak die?</p></blockquote>
<p>It sounds like the right thing to do: Not letting the weak die. And obviously I don’t want my grandparents, or yours, to die.<br/>
There is a price to this lockdown however. A price paid by another group of “weak” people: Not bodily weak, but monetarily weak. Poor people.</p>
<p>Societies all over the globe pay a hefty price for the recession that’s coming, not to mention in liberties and rights they now already have lost.</p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-right" id="comment-133851">
<div class="wpd-comment-header">
<div class="wpd-comment-author">
Fabrice
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-date" title="Mar 27, 2020 7:34 AM">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="far fa-clock"></i>
Mar 27, 2020 7:34 AM
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-share wpd-hidden wpd-tooltip wpd-top">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-share-alt"></i>
<div class="wpd-tooltip-content">
<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Status of COVID-19
As of 19 Ma... &amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2020%2F03%2F23%2Fitaly-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause%2F%23comment-133851" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-space"></div>
<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/#comment-133851"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Status of COVID-19</p>
<p>As of 19 March 2020, COVID-19 is no longer considered to be a high consequence infectious diseases (HCID) in the UK.</p>
<p>The 4 nations public health HCID group made an interim recommendation in January 2020 to classify COVID-19 as an HCID. This was based on consideration of the UK HCID criteria about the virus and the disease with information available during the early stages of the outbreak. Now that more is known about COVID-19, the public health bodies in the UK have reviewed the most up to date information about COVID-19 against the UK HCID criteria. They have determined that several features have now changed; in particular, more information is available about mortality rates (low overall), and there is now greater clinical awareness and a specific and sensitive laboratory test, the availability of which continues to increase.</p>
<p>The Advisory Committee on Dangerous Pathogens (ACDP) is also of the opinion that COVID-19 should no longer be classified as an HCID.</p>
<p>Source and continuation:</p>
<p><a href="https://www.gov.uk/guidance/high-consequence-infectious-diseases-hcid#status-of-covid-19" rel="nofollow ugc">https://www.gov.uk/guidance/high-consequence-infectious-diseases-hcid#status-of-covid-19</a></p>
<p>Did British media mainstream give the news?</p>
<p>No, they didn’t, how about?</p>
<p>Welcome to the wildest Orwellian regime!</p>
<p>Fabrice, greetings from Italy.</p>
<p>PS in reference to the final comment “Welcome to the wildest Orwellian regime!”, obviuosly the same is true in Italy , France, USA and so on, the common factor of all these Western countries is NATO, just a strange coincidence? I don’t think so.</p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-reply-to">

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>It is the same as when old people die of pneumonia, while they are waiting to die of causes, that put them into hospital!</p>

<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/#comment-133604"></i></span>

<div class="wpd-reply-to">
<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-133279">
Loulou
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>When you have a chronic illness, such as diabetes, cancer, cardiovascular or respiratory conditions, all of which are underlying factors in the majority of CoV deaths, you are basically counting the days no matter what. Something’s going to kill each and every one of us. So, for those who come to this situation, each day is even more of a blessing. With or without CoV, something is going to kill them sooner rather than later. People who have these conditions KNOW this. Everyone on earth should not be expected to place their lives in a bubble to protect medically frail individuals from…. what? Their days are numbered, as are the ones I have on Earth, too.</p>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-footer">

Reply to 
<a href="#comment-133604">
Dee Cee
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Dee Cee<br/>
Let’s just get this clear. To make it simple…people with psoriasis are often on immune suppressant drugs. Those people are living healthy productive lives. However getting something like Covid 19 could be disasterous for them because of the drugs they are on. There are all sorts of people out there living life fully and young that have underlying conditions. To say it’s okay that these people were going to die anyway is just thoughtless and cruel.</p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>It is indeed cruel. And something nobody likes.</p>
<p>But yet, Dee Cee’s question is a fair one: How many days taken from one group, is a fair price for one more day for the other?</p>
<p>All our time on this planet is limited. It is valuable to all of us.</p>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>You have forgotten one thing… I am 83, still here, yet many much younger have gone…most owing to a drink/cigarette/lifestyle…so why should I be blamed and resented because I am still here?<br/>
I am here because I took life as precious, so did not throw it away!<br/>
No mention about the millions of youngsters who all over the world waste police and other emergency funds getting stewed over each weekend…so EVERY person deserves medical treatment, with result based on the way they have been physically responsible gor themselves.<br/>
Also, Coronavirus IS thus season’s Corona type….law should state folk who HAVE a cold should be indoors, anyone free to notiify authorities of folk who ignire this.<br/>
In truth, our awful politicians were scarrd stiff at all the mass demos last year, sparked by Greta Thunberg…so the right wing fascists amongst them…..used falsely statted Corona, to put us under unlawful house arrest.<br/>
I went through WWII..so these politicians have done what Hitler failed to do without a shot being fired!</p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-tooltip-content">
<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=It means that the Italian deat... &amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2020%2F03%2F23%2Fitaly-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause%2F%23comment-133028" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>
</div>

<div class="wpd-space"></div>
<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/#comment-133028"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<blockquote><p>It means that the Italian death toll figures could have been artificially inflated by up to 88%.</p></blockquote>
<p>No, it’s far worse than that. You’ve used the wrong denominator.</p>
<p>If the promulgated number is 100, but the actual number is 12… the promulgated number is overstated by (100/12)× which is 8.33× which is 833%.</p>
<p>So</p>
<blockquote><p>It means that the Italian death toll figures could have been artificially inflated by up to <strong>833</strong>%.</p></blockquote>
</div>

<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=It makes perfect sense. Worldo... &amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2020%2F03%2F23%2Fitaly-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause%2F%23comment-132929" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-space"></div>
<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/#comment-132929"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>It makes perfect sense. Worldometer added a new column the other day, “tot deaths/1M pop”. Ignoring San Marino, whose population is tiny, the top 5 are:</p>
<p>Italy 124<br/>
Spain 74<br/>
Iran 25<br/>
Netherlands 21<br/>
France 20</p>
<p>The UK is way below this on just 6. </p>
<p>If you take the figure for Italy 124 and multiply by 12% you get: 15, which is much more reasonable. Spain’s figure is also way ahead of the rest for some reason.</p>
</div>

</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/#comment-132912"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>What’s with the surge in hospital admissions then? Causation is not clean and simple, to be sure, but, whatever it is, it is clear that a viral epidemic is indeed sending a wave of people to the hospital and putting them in critical conditions. Doctors aren’t going out into the community and dragging people in there.</p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Hospitals have to deal with epidemics every few years. They just aren’t usually newsworthy. Ever heard a hospital to say they had enough funding and never any shortages?</p>

Reply to 
<a href="#comment-132931">
John Pretty
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>I have never heard of hospitals and their personnel being this overwhelmed by an epidemic – lacking capacity for its victims and safety equipment for personnel as has happened in Italy, Spain, New York, and to a lesser degree in Seattle.</p>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-footer">
<div class="wpd-vote">
<div class="wpd-vote-up wpd_not_clicked">

Reply to 
<a href="#comment-132912">
pigswiggle
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>this is a very good point, regarding hospital beds. but one thing, I have yet to see or hear anybody mention this is why not look at total deaths per million/per day (both the “per million” and per day are arbitrary) and compare it to historical norms. you can compare to March of previous years in a country to adjust for seasonal. add a trend component if need be. Thus, if all other things are equal, and Spain is reporting 500 deaths a day from corona, but compared to norms, the total deaths are only increasing say, by 200 deaths, then the 200 is a better reflection of what is going on. need to do over a week or so to get an average that is not influenced by an outlier day.</p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/#comment-133039"></i></span>

<div class="wpd-reply-to">
<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-132937">
John Grenci
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Although I upvoted, there’s also a requirement to account for whether the comparison week had some other charactgeristic (then or now) – if last year was a particularly benign flu year, and/or this year is a particularly nasty one, for example.</p>
<p>Ideally, it would be best to calculate some rolling daily average (which would have the benefit of giving a rough estimate at some error bars around the average) and then test if the two intervals were statistically different. </p>
<p>People are approaching the numbers as if everything’s deterministic, when it’s not. There’s vast amounts of uncertainty embedded in every number – including ‘confirmed cases’, given that the test spits out at least 60% false positives: “<a href="https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/32133832" rel="nofollow ugc">Zhuang <em>et al</em></a>” (2020) say it’s as high as 80.3%, with 75% probability that it’s above 47%.</p>
<p>(The flip side of that: it implies that the false negative rate is above 50% too. Permitting a person who tests negative to leave, is slightly worse odds than a coin toss)</p>
<p>Reference…</p>
<p>Zhuang <em>et al</em> (too many co-authors to bother with), “<a href="https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/32133832" rel="nofollow ugc"><i>Potential false-positive rate among the ‘asymptomatic infected individuals’ in close contacts of COVID-19 patients</i></a>” (link is to English abstract)</p>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-footer">
<div class="wpd-vote">

</div>

<p>Compared to what? </p>
<p>What is the normal rate of hospital admissions in the relevant parts of Italy at comparable times of year?</p>
<p>What is the normal rate of (hospitalisation/ICU/death) for respiratory distress in the relevant parts of Italy at comparable times of year?</p>

Reply to 
<a href="#comment-133035">
Kratoklastes
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>I don’t have information about this from Italy, but we do from New York. It’s much higher. Look at the second graph, which represents ER admissions.</p>
<p><a href="https://www1.nyc.gov/assets/doh/downloads/pdf/imm/covid-19-syndromic-surveillance.pdf" rel="nofollow ugc">https://www1.nyc.gov/assets/doh/downloads/pdf/imm/covid-19-syndromic-surveillance.pdf</a></p>
<p>By the way, health care workers are disproportionate victims here. They are also the healthiest victims. They receive massive “doses” of the virus while treating patients with insufficient protective equipment, which causes more severe symptoms. The more they are overwhelmed, the more nurses and doctors will die. We are all a potential murder weapon.</p>
</div>

<p>In fact, senior care facilities in Northern Italy cannot treat medical complications caused by age related conditions, so hospitals are being filled with at risk seniors.</p>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Boris’s Address to the Nation…”Are you dying, perhaps you are a bed blocker. Are you afraid that you will die before you recieve The Liverpool Care Pathway? Perhaps granny is a bed blocker in just this situation. This is why, I must bring in the social distancing rules. Experts have told me, too many such bed blockers will die before they can recieve their scheduled LCP. Do not visit and comfort the dying instead, because I am not heartless, you can say goodbye by mobile. You must obey these instructions, the dying are relying on you. Remember, we are all in this together, except if you have decent medical insurance and don’t have to worry about all the austerity cuts. Enjoy your kool aid”.<br/>
Drivel I wrote and posted earlier in the Mail. It didn’t go down well at all…hahahahaha</p>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Sheep brains do not realise that red flagging is just absolutely the wrong thing to do.<br/>
The Mail is defo an intel op (as if any of the mainstream media isn’t), the comments full of paid shills using shill software such as megaphone: </p>
<blockquote><p>The Megaphone Desktop Tool acted as a wrapper around an RSS feed from the GIYUS website. Originally, it gave the user the option of going to a particular site with a poll, and if the user chooses to go to the site, the software then casts a vote automatically, when this is technically feasible, but that feature had been discontinued. </p></blockquote>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Perhaps deaths with co-morbidity should or could be described as COVID=19 exacerbating pre-existing conditions. The question is, would the person have died at that moment [i.e. with COVID-19]?</p>
</div>

<p>Not really. Many people die and test positively for a virus. It doesn’t mean that it killed them. A lung cancer patient and lifelong heavy smoker who dies tests positive for coronavirus. What killed them?</p>

<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-132808">
Teresa Shepherd
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>It’s not that easy to establish the exact cause of death in a single patient with co-morbities. Best way is to use statistics and check the number of all-cause deaths that day with what you would expect from previous years. If Coronavirus is such a significant cause of death there should be a noticeable spike. So far this has not occurred. In fact, the graph of over 65 year-old deaths in Italy shows <em>less</em> deaths this year than in previous ones.</p>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-footer">

<div class="wpd-tooltip-content">
<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Covid-19 being the last straw&amp;... &amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2020%2F03%2F23%2Fitaly-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause%2F%23comment-136304" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>

<div class="wpd-space"></div>
<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/#comment-136304"></i></span>
</div>

<div class="wpd-reply-to">
<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-132808">
Teresa Shepherd
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Covid-19 being the last straw… but still the actual cause of death if tested positive. From my observations Donald Trump and Boris Johnson have been underplaying the problem. Deaths and numbers for each area are not easy to find. I’ve been told [hearsay] that relatives are being asked to give permission in writing for the cause of death to be recorded as Covid-19. I can see the argument for eugenics, which if the case, would explain the delay in lockdown when WHO were urging it and it had been implemented much sooner in some countries with the result that the increase in numbers have been far lower, a third or less. Same with the USA. Eugenics could also explain the delay in accessing ventilators, which to me could either be deliberate or incompetent. Either way they’re culpable in some respect, rather like Watergate. I’m not putting forward this view, just adding to the mix. I can believe the worst of this Government but I’m on the fence in all respects, teetering really – so far. I do fear they’ve manipulated the crisis to their own agenda to cull the elderly and ‘economically inactive’ – and all those weakened by the stress of austerity – a major consequence of chronic stress is that the constant flow of cortisol compromises the immune system and the brain capacity to manage it. They are going to be more likely to die from Covid-19 – would that then mean their cause of death should be recorded as a compromised immune system resulting form chronic stress? So far I can’t buy the arguments re martial law but I do feel uncomfortable with it.</p>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-footer">

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>I should have added that were they overstating deaths as an excuse to impose martial law then there would have been less underplaying of the problem, but it is possible that as it played out they saw a way to take advantage of the situation. It wouldn’t be surprising but still, I’m not decided.</p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-header">
<div class="wpd-comment-author">
Grim Reaper
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-date" title="Mar 25, 2020 5:54 AM">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="far fa-clock"></i>
Mar 25, 2020 5:54 AM
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-share wpd-hidden wpd-tooltip wpd-top">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-share-alt"></i>
<div class="wpd-tooltip-content">
<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=“It means thousands of d... &amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2020%2F03%2F23%2Fitaly-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause%2F%23comment-132600" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-space"></div>
<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/#comment-132600"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>“It means thousands of deaths currently widely attributed to Covid19, and being used to justify the introduction of measures equating to medical martial law, may not have died of covid19 at all but of their serious chronic co-morbidity (cancer, heart disease etc.).”</p>
<p>Yes people may still have died of their co-morbidity and the co-morbidity may not have been enough to lead to those deaths in the short term or longer term, so all that can be said is the Coronavirus was correlated with the deaths, when those deaths occurred – and potentially sooner rather than later.</p>
</div>

<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=“only 12 per cent of dea... &amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2020%2F03%2F23%2Fitaly-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause%2F%23comment-132587" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>

<div class="wpd-space"></div>
<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/#comment-132587"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>“only 12 per cent of death certificates have shown a direct causality from coronavirus”</p>
<p>I’m new to this website. Have lived with HIV 27 years the majority without medication or with a low dosage regimen.  The description above is poor science. 80% of the deaths are correlated with the Coronavirus. Why have a whole discussion around terminology. If you end up being one of the people who dies where Coronavirus is present will you care if it was merely a tipping point where health trended downward???</p>
</div>

<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/#comment-132590"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-reply-to">
<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-132587">
Grim Reaper
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>“It means thousands of deaths currently widely attributed to Covid19, and being used to justify the introduction of measures equating to medical martial law, may not have died of covid19 at all but of their serious chronic co-morbidity (cancer, heart disease etc.).”</p>
<p>No, without Coronavirus present, those deaths may not have happened at all, so Coronavirus is correlated with those deaths. That’s what the MSM should have reported. As an aside in Australia the Guardian has a woman with a qualification in epidemiology who reports on medical articles.</p>
</div>

<a href="#comment-132590">
Grim Reaper

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Since you are the grim reaper, you should know the important distinction between ‘died’ of’ and ‘died with the presence of’. An autopsy and viral load test etc I imagine would be necessary to conclusively determine this important difference. Minus this, the only conclusive cases would be mortalities with zero co-morbidities. But there are hardly any. And yet so many people are all too eager to eat up this nothing-fear-burger, almost like it’s satisfying a public craving.</p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/#comment-133067"></i></span>

<div class="wpd-reply-to">
<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-132828">
Sam - Admin2
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<blockquote><p>“An autopsy and viral load test etc I imagine would be necessary to conclusively determine this important difference.”</p></blockquote>
<p>He (presumably, from the historical portrayal of the pseudonym and assuming the post is genuine) is a long term ‘living with HIV almost without drugs’ sufferer–interesting in itself, I should have thought–and, as someone who must every day be <em>acutely consciously aware</em> in the face of what are to most people usually nothing more than commonplace, trivial passing infections, to which they generally give <em>almost no thought</em>, he clearly states a position which in no way contradicts that of the article:</p>
<blockquote>
<blockquote><p>“Yes people may still have died of their co-morbidity and the co-morbidity may not have been enough to lead to those deaths in the short term or longer term, <em>so all that can be said is the Coronavirus was correlated with the deaths, when those deaths occurred – and potentially sooner rather than later.</em>” [Empasis added]</p></blockquote>
</blockquote>
<p>and</p>
<blockquote>
<blockquote><p>“If you end up being one of the people who dies where Coronavirus is present will you care if it was merely a tipping point where health trended downward???”</p></blockquote>
</blockquote>
<p>In fact, not only does he <em>not</em> contradict the point of the article, he–almost uniquely in this BTL land–illuminates that point with simple humanity positioned where the monomaniacally intolerant parrot usually perches.</p>
<p>And yes, of course he knows “the important distinction between ‘died’ of’ and ‘died with the presence of’”, he lives with it as a clear and present <em>condition</em> of his life–and in fact everyone’s life, however denied that usually is–every hour of every day. “Viral load” has been part of the writing on the wall of his mind for 27 years and, he seems to <em>continue</em> to hope, counting.</p>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-footer">

<p><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Post_hoc_ergo_propter_hoc" rel="nofollow ugc">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Post_hoc_ergo_propter_hoc</a></p>

<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-132587">
Grim Reaper
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Because nobody would bother testing for SARS-CoV-2 or any other form of Coronavirus, or Rhinovirus or whatever other cold and flu causing pathogen is doing the rounds in under any other circumstances than this.</p>
<p>We’re looking for something, finding it, then concluding it’s the cause of the problem. Italy is reporting vastly higher fatality rates than everywhere else and their reporting practices explain this, which is the point of the article.</p>
</div>

Reply to 
<a href="#comment-132667">
Cicatriz
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<blockquote><p>“We’re looking for something, finding it, then concluding it’s the cause of the problem. Italy is reporting vastly higher fatality rates than everywhere else and their reporting practices explain this, which is the point of the article.”</p></blockquote>
<p>Did you write the book, “How to Miss Another’s Point While Piling On Your Own”, or are just using it as a style guide? Alternatively, just which syllable in</p>
<blockquote>
<blockquote><p>“…so all that can be said is the Coronavirus was correlated with the deaths, when those deaths occurred – and potentially sooner rather than later.”</p></blockquote>
</blockquote>
<p>do you fail to comprehend as not contradicting the ‘point of the article’?</p>
</div>

<p>You have previously reported that over 99% of those who died in Italy after being infected with the “novel” coronavirus had pre-existing conditions. In this report the 99% figure has dropped to 88%. Which report is to be believed?</p>

<div class="wpd-comment-right" id="comment-132352">
<div class="wpd-comment-header">
<div class="wpd-comment-author">
Charlotte Russe
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-date" title="Mar 24, 2020 8:36 PM">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="far fa-clock"></i>
Mar 24, 2020 8:36 PM
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-share wpd-hidden wpd-tooltip wpd-top">
<i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-share-alt"></i>
<div class="wpd-tooltip-content">
<a class="wc_tw" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=“I want you to remember ... &amp;url=https%3A%2F%2Foff-guardian.org%2F2020%2F03%2F23%2Fitaly-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause%2F%23comment-132352" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Twitter"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-twitter wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_vk" href="https://vk.com/share.php?url=https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On VKontakte"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-vk wpf-cta"></i></a><a class="wc_ok" href="https://connect.ok.ru/offer?url=https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Share On Odnoklassniki"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fab fa-odnoklassniki wpf-cta"></i></a>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-space"></div>
<div class="wpd-comment-link wpd-hidden">
<span wpd-tooltip="Comment Link" wpd-tooltip-position="left"><i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-link" data-wpd-clipboard="https://off-guardian.org/2020/03/23/italy-only-12-of-covid19-deaths-list-covid19-as-cause/#comment-132352"></i></span>
</div>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>“I want you to remember these people died WITH the coronavirus and not FROM the coronavirus.”</p>
<p>In other words, a patient could be hospitalized with stage four cancer, a heart condition, or for liver disease and subsequently contract COVID 19 in the same way hospital patients frequently die from pneumonia. </p>
<p>Oh my, who would have thought a hospital is a hotbed for germs and bacteria. Pneumonia, is probably what they’re dying from. When pneumonia is acquired in a hospital it tends to be more virulent, because the germs present in a hospital are often more aggressive and resistant to treatment. You can thank the overprescribing of antibiotics by physicians for this problem. Germs, want to survive like any other organism so they mutate to resist antibiotics. That’s why it’s wise to only use antibiotics sparingly and not for every little infection. If you take antibiotics too frequently your body will build up a resistance, and if you develop a serious infection they’ll need to treat the condition with a more powerful antibiotic, if one exists……..</p>
<p>Advice, if you can stay out of hospitals, do so. They’re rife with high resistant germs and bacteria….. In addition, try to build up your own immunity with vitamin supplements, a healthy diet, and regular exercise. And don’t smoke! Twenty-five percent of Italians smoke cigarettes.</p>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-footer">

<div class="wpd-reply-to">
<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-132352">
Charlotte Russe
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>‘ “I want you to remember these people died WITH the coronavirus and not FROM the coronavirus.”</p>
<p>It is worse, a patient comes in very sick and coughing, doomed so to say, and gets tested for CV19. The PCR test result is negative, but the patient is still Diagnosed as CV19+. – Why: because doctors fear to miss ‘the deadly and highly contagious CV19’ and therefore ‘clinically diagnose’ the patient as CV19+, after the poor lad gets admitted in isolation, and (when things detoriate, as happens in doomed patients) gets intubated and still dies days later due to multi-organ failure, which the doctors score as death due to Covid19.</p>
<p>This scenario is not far sought at all…</p>
<p>Up till all this began, people who had such a clinical scenario weren’t even sent to hospital, as they were given the decent option to die in their own home and surroundings.</p>
<p>When will this foolishness stop? When will it dawn on doctors that they are not saving patients (they could not be saved anyway), but only create an ‘epidemic’ by counting death due to normal causes as death due to coronavirus?</p>
<p>Someday it will stop and the sooner the better.</p>
</div>

<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Not to mention family willingness to live and let live, the whereabouts of your last will, and other key social distancing, to use a current euphemism….NB:</p>
<p>KAFKA “METAMORPHOSIS” REDUX, A CENTURY’S UPDATE:</p>
<p>“Gregor Samsa awoke one morning to find he had been transformed into a gigantic insect. As his novel virus progressed throughout the day, he was told by family members to shelter in place. Later, protocols of social distancing were added.”</p>
<p>“And so it goes.’ –Slaughterhouse 5, Vonnegut.</p>
</div>

<i class="far fa-comments"></i>
Reply to 
<a href="#comment-132540">
Robbobbobin
</a>
</div>
<div class="wpd-comment-text">
<p>Strictly it is the bacteria that build up resistance, not the body. And they don’t strictly “build up ” resistance: it’s more that those that can be killed by the antibiotic are killed, leaving more resources for those (perhaps a tiny handful at first) that can’t. Those then multiply at the fantastic speeds characteristic of bacteria in a favourable environment…</p>
<p>But Charlotte Russe’s conclusion is absolutely correct: overuse of antibiotics eventually makes them useless.</p>
</div>

</div>

<blockquote><p>“But Charlotte Russe’s conclusion is absolutely correct: overuse of antibiotics eventually makes them useless.”</p></blockquote>
<p>Didn’t say it wasn’t.</p>
<p>But then she didn’t say “…overuse of antibiotics eventually makes them useless” because that wasn’t her conclusion. Arse about face insight reveals the arse, obscures the face. That’s because it’s not insight.</p>

<p>I see I have already collected two 👎 dickwits who are also unable to distinguish between their bodies and a pathogen.
